author: DistroTube
description:
The 'shuf' command is used to generate random permutations. In other words, it "shuffles" lines of text or series of numbers.

- Shuffle the order of lines in a file and output the result:
shuf path/to/file

- Only output the a certain "number" of entries in the result:
shuf -n 10 path/to/file

- Write the "output" to another file:
shuf path/to/input_file -o path/to/output_file

- Generate a random ordering of an "input" range 1-10:
shuf -i 1-10

- Generate a random odering of an "input" range 1-100 and out 1 entry:
shuf -i 1-100 -n 1
NOTE Useful in situations where you want to randomize your actions based on percentages.

- "Repeatedly" generate a random ordering of an "input" range of numbers 1-10:
shuf -i 1-10 -r
title: 'shuf' - generate random permutations - Video Man Pages
